Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the critics were lying by stating that they were "just lying."
Understate: The claim understates the previous reported maternal mortality rate in Texas by stating that it is "less than half of what the critics said" and "about 1/10 of 1%."
Falters at times: The claim falters by suggesting that the critics were completely wrong, while the data entry errors were the main reason for the discrepancy.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the critics were intentionally lying about the maternal mortality rate.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the critics intentionally lied about the maternal mortality rate without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge the alternative explanation that the initial data reported by the state was incorrect due to errors in data entry on death certificates.
